bibl.title: Military Orders for James F. Presnell, August 6, 1900

div1.p: Special Orders #129 selects Presnell to accompany 2nd artillery. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Military Orders for James F. Presnell, August 6, 1900
div1.p:
Adjutant General's
OFFICE.
SEP 1 1900
ROLLS DIVISION.
[unclear]

[unclear]
RECD. AUG 18 1900
Presnell

FROM THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 129. }

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, August 6, 1900.

1. Leave of absence for two (2) months on surgeon's
certificate of disability, with permission to go beyond the
limits of the Division, is hereby granted Major Edgar S.
Dudley, Judge Advocate, U.S. Volunteers, Judge Advocate
of the Division.

2. Under A. R. 1272, the Subsistence Department will
commute the rations, in advance, of Corporal Albert Baier
and Privates ----- Tullinger, ----- Stovall and -----
Story, company I, 1st Infantry, now in this city awaiting
the departure of a transport to the United States, for four
(4) days, from August 5 to August 8, 1900, both days in-
clusive, at the rate of seventy-five (75) cents per day, it
being impracticable to provide for their subsistence in any
other way.

3. Contract Nurse Elizabeth H. Holmes, U. S. Army, hav-
ing reported at these Headquarters, in compliance with
telegraphic instructions from the Surgeon General, U. S.
Army, will proceed to Matanzas, Cuba, reporting upon ar-
rival to the post surgeon, Hamilton Barracks, for assign-
ment to duty.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

4. The following named medical officers and enlisted
men of the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, will accompany
the second battalion of the 1st Infantry and the light bat-
tery of the 2d Artillery to the United States on the govern-
ment transport Crook:
With 2d battalion, 1st Infantry:
Acting Assistant Surgeon J. F. Dunshie, U. S. Army;
Acting Assistant Surgeon A. A. Nouel, U. S. Army;
Acting Hospital Steward E. P. Hammond;

Acting Hospital Steward C. G. Sturtevant, and ten (10)
privates of the Hospital Corps, U. S. Army, to be
selected by the Chief Surgeon of the Department
of Western Cuba.
With light battery F, 2d Artillery:

Acting Assistant Surgeon J. F. Presnell, U. S. Army,
and three (3) privates of the Hospital Corps, U. S.
Army, to be selected by the Chief Surgeon of the
Department of Western Cuba.

Upon arrival in the United States, and when their ser-
vices are no longer required with the troops they accompa-
nied, the medical officers will report by letter to the Sur-
geon General of the Army for further orders, forwarding
at the same time a list of the enlisted men under their di-
rection.

5. 1st Lieutenant A. P. Berry, Battalion Adjutant 10th
Infantry, now temporarily at Cárdenas Barracks, Cárdenas,
Cuba, will proceed to join his proper station, Morro Castle,
Santiago, Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

H. L. SCOTT,
Assistant Adjutant General.
